other_tests.findings: Excision of left middle finger and right breast tumor.
Excision of left proximal sciatic, right femoral, and distal medial thigh tumors.
Removal of bilateral retromastoid scalp lesions and exploration of previously resected right saphenous nerve mass, revealing a painful scar neuroma.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, the patient was stable; transiently slightly weaker in her left hip flexor but was able to bear weight.

other_tests.findings: Removal of two 3-cm tumors from left posterior thigh and medial buttock.
Removal of left mons pubis lesion and a large left femoral nerve sheath tumor.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperative recovery was excellent with normal strength and sensation.

other_tests.findings: Removal of tumors from the left infraclavicular brachial plexus, left breast, and right medial thigh, all firm, well-encapsulated masses.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Gross-total resection was performed in each case.

other_tests.findings: Initial genetic testing (germline) for NF1 was negative; resected tumor analysis also showed no mutation.
Tumors exhibited the same histology and immunohistochemical staining results across multiple resections.
